name: Minseok Kim
education: B.S. Information Systems (SUNY Stony Brook, 2019-2023), GPA 3.60/4.0
summary: Full-stack/DevOps engineer (~1.2 years). Builds end-to-end products and infra: coding-battle game platform (React/TypeScript, FastAPI, RabbitMQ, autoscaling via queue metrics), real-estate field survey app (Spring Boot, MySQL, HA/DR on AWS + VMware ESXi), cloud/infra automation labs (Ansible, Proxmox, Terraform), and academic/side apps (banking, hackathons).

Ownership: Led 'Imjangdan' backend and HA/DR infra; coordinated roles and delivery.
Drove queue-metric autoscaling strategy on Code Ground.
Communication: Presented hands-on 'Terraform & Ansible IaC' seminar and authored lab materials.
Problem_Solving: Replaced memory-based ASG policy with RabbitMQ queue metrics to improve responsiveness.
Designed Active-Standby with AWS + ESXi for resilience.
Learning_Growth: Built diverse side projects (banking, fashion recommendation, defense wiki) to broaden domain knowledge.
Leadership_Mentoring: Acted as team lead on capstone, enabling peers via role distribution and mentoring.
Operational_Excellence: Introduced HA/DR and observability (ES, Prometheus, Grafana) in project infra.

name: Donghyun Kim
summary: Backend engineer focused on reliability and observability. Delivered a cost-efficient crawling pipeline (Spring Batch→Lambda/Playwright→S3→RDS) with Prometheus/Grafana/Loki; refactored a legacy service using 250 tests and CI/CD; developed a study-recruitment platform emphasizing transactional correctness and Testcontainers-based integration tests.

Problem_Solving: Eliminated test flakiness from JPA/@Transactional by adopting Testcontainers and revising boundaries.

Craftsmanship_CodeQuality: Standardized test patterns and layered architecture; converted to multi-module structure.
Operational_Excellence: Implemented Prometheus/Loki monitoring and alerting to cut detection time from ~30m to ~2m.
